main event: A kite-shaped object the size of a nickel was observed by a pilot flying at 10,500 feet in Needles, California on July 3, 1959.
interesting points: The object initially appeared to be an eagle coming toward the windshield., The object hovered and flew back and forth but remained in a relatively stationary position., The pilot's aircraft could not close in on the object, despite flying at approximately 140 mph., The sighting lasted for about 10 minutes and occurred at dusk., The pilot speculated that the rays of the setting sun through dust particles might have contributed to the sighting.
